main event: A fire lookout observed an oval object displaying red on one side and green on the other in Corvallis, Oregon on August 11, 1955.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a quarter at arm's length as seen through firefighting equipment,The sighting was noted at 2311 hours and lasted at least until the time of the report,The object was observed moving left and right,The conclusion suggested it was either a balloon or an astronomical phenomenon,The observer expressed that it could have been influenced by meteological or astronomical causes.
sighted object: an oval object with red and green colors
